block.p: Katherine Ann Schlesinger, a daughter of Sheila and Richard Schlesinger of Pound Ridge, N.Y., was married at her parents' house yesterday to Richard Matthiessen Fates, a son of Linda and Richard Fates of Hamilton, Mass. The Rev. Sally Thacher, a United Church of Christ minister, performed the ceremony.
The couple graduated from Yale University.

Katherine Ann Schlesinger, a daughter of Sheila and Richard Schlesinger of Pound Ridge, N.Y., was married at her parents' house yesterday to Richard Matthiessen Fates, a son of Linda and Richard Fates of Hamilton, Mass. The Rev. Sally Thacher, a United Church of Christ minister, performed the ceremony.
The couple graduated from Yale University.

Mrs. Fates, 23, was a media planner for Hill, Holliday, Connors, Cosmopulos, the Boston advertising agency, until April. In September, she is to become the recruiting and marketing director in West Lebanon, N.H., for Swiss Challenge, which runs a summer camp for children in Zermatt, Switzerland. Her father owns Schlesinger & Company, a commercial real estate brokerage company in New York.

Mr. Fates, 26, is known as Matt. Until recently, he was a research analyst in Wellesley, Mass., for Norwest Venture Partners. In September, he plans to begin studying for an M.B.A. at Dartmouth College. His mother is the director of major gifts at Harvard University. His father is the regional president in central Massachusetts for the FleetBoston Financial Corporation.
